MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string? BuildQuery (string[]? projectionIn, string? selection, string? groupBy, string? having, string? sortOrder, string? limit);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string BuildQuery(string[] projectionIn, string selection, string groupBy, string having, string sortOrder, string limit) cil managed
Public Overridable Function BuildQuery (projectionIn As String(), selection As String, groupBy As String, having As String, sortOrder As String, limit As String) As String

public: virtual System::String ^ BuildQuery(cli::array <System::String ^> ^ projectionIn, System::String ^ selection, System::String ^ groupBy, System::String ^ having, System::String ^ sortOrder, System::String ^ limit);
abstract member BuildQuery : string[] * string * string * string * string * string -> string override this.BuildQuery : string[] * string * string * string * string * string -> string
MemberSignature.Usage: sQLiteQueryBuilder.BuildQuery (projectionIn, selection, groupBy, having, sortOrder, limit)

Docs.param: A list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns, which is discouraged to prevent reading data from storage that isn't going to be used.
A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given URL.
A filter declaring how to group rows, formatted as an SQL GROUP BY clause (excluding the GROUP BY itself). Passing null will cause the rows to not be grouped.

A filter declare which row groups to include in the cursor, if row grouping is being used, formatted as an SQL HAVING clause (excluding the HAVING itself). Passing null will cause all row groups to be included, and is required when row grouping is not being used.
How to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
Limits the number of rows returned by the query, formatted as LIMIT clause. Passing null denotes no LIMIT clause.
Docs.summary: Construct a SELECT statement suitable for use in a group of SELECT statements that will be joined through UNION operators in buildUnionQuery.

format.a: Java documentation for android.database.sqlite.SQLiteQueryBuilder.buildQuery(java.lang.String[], java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String).

How to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string? BuildQueryString (bool distinct, string? tables, string[]? columns, string? where, string? groupBy, string? having, string? orderBy, string? limit);
.method public static hidebysig string BuildQueryString(bool distinct, string tables, string[] columns, string where, string groupBy, string having, string orderBy, string limit) cil managed

Public Shared Function BuildQueryString (distinct As Boolean, tables As String, columns As String(), where As String, groupBy As String, having As String, orderBy As String, limit As String) As String

public: static System::String ^ BuildQueryString(bool distinct, System::String ^ tables, cli::array <System::String ^> ^ columns, System::String ^ where, System::String ^ groupBy, System::String ^ having, System::String ^ orderBy, System::String ^ limit);
static member BuildQueryString : bool * string * string[] * string * string * string * string * string -> string
MemberSignature.Usage: Android.Database.Sqlite.SQLiteQueryBuilder.BuildQueryString (distinct, tables, columns, where, groupBy, having, orderBy, limit)

Docs.param: true if you want each row to be unique, false otherwise.
The table names to compile the query against.
A list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns, which is discouraged to prevent reading data from storage that isn't going to be used.
A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given URL.
A filter declaring how to group rows, formatted as an SQL GROUP BY clause (excluding the GROUP BY itself). Passing null will cause the rows to not be grouped.

A filter declare which row groups to include in the cursor, if row grouping is being used, formatted as an SQL HAVING clause (excluding the HAVING itself). Passing null will cause all row groups to be included, and is required when row grouping is not being used.
How to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
Limits the number of rows returned by the query, formatted as LIMIT clause. Passing null denotes no LIMIT clause.
Docs.summary: Build an SQL query string from the given clauses.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string? BuildUnionQuery (string[]? subQueries, string? sortOrder, string? limit);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string BuildUnionQuery(string[] subQueries, string sortOrder, string limit) cil managed
Public Overridable Function BuildUnionQuery (subQueries As String(), sortOrder As String, limit As String) As String
public: virtual System::String ^ BuildUnionQuery(cli::array <System::String ^> ^ subQueries, System::String ^ sortOrder, System::String ^ limit);
abstract member BuildUnionQuery : string[] * string * string -> string override this.BuildUnionQuery : string[] * string * string -> string

Docs.param: an array of SQL SELECT statements, all of which must have the same columns as the same positions in their results
How to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
The limit clause, which applies to the entire union result set
Docs.summary: Given a set of subqueries, all of which are SELECT statements, construct a query that returns the union of what those subqueries return.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string? BuildUnionSubQuery (string? typeDiscriminatorColumn, string[]? unionColumns, System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<string>? columnsPresentInTable, int computedColumnsOffset, string? typeDiscriminatorValue, string? selection, string? groupBy, string? having);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string BuildUnionSubQuery(string typeDiscriminatorColumn, string[] unionColumns, class System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1<string> columnsPresentInTable, int32 computedColumnsOffset, string typeDiscriminatorValue, string selection, string groupBy, string having) cil managed

Public Overridable Function BuildUnionSubQuery (typeDiscriminatorColumn As String, unionColumns As String(), columnsPresentInTable As ICollection(Of String), computedColumnsOffset As Integer, typeDiscriminatorValue As String, selection As String, groupBy As String, having As String) As String

public: virtual System::String ^ BuildUnionSubQuery(System::String ^ typeDiscriminatorColumn, cli::array <System::String ^> ^ unionColumns, System::Collections::Generic::ICollection<System::String ^> ^ columnsPresentInTable, int computedColumnsOffset, System::String ^ typeDiscriminatorValue, System::String ^ selection, System::String ^ groupBy, System::String ^ having);

abstract member BuildUnionSubQuery : string * string[] * System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<string> * int * string * string * string * string -> string override this.BuildUnionSubQuery : string * string[] * System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<string> * int * string * string * string * string -> string
MemberSignature.Usage: sQLiteQueryBuilder.BuildUnionSubQuery (typeDiscriminatorColumn, unionColumns, columnsPresentInTable, computedColumnsOffset, typeDiscriminatorValue, selection, groupBy, having)

Docs.param: the name of the result column whose cells will contain the name of the table from which each row was drawn.

the names of the columns to appear in the result. This may include columns that do not appear in the table this SELECT is querying (i.e. mTables), but that do appear in one of the other tables in the UNION query that we are constructing.

a Set of the names of the columns that appear in this table (i.e. in the table whose name is mTables). Since columns in unionColumns include columns that appear only in other tables, we use this array to distinguish which ones actually are present. Other columns will have NULL values for results from this subquery.
all columns in unionColumns before this index are included under the assumption that they're computed and therefore won't appear in columnsPresentInTable, e.g. "date * 1000 as normalized_date"
the value used for the type-discriminator column in this subquery
A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given URL.
A filter declaring how to group rows, formatted as an SQL GROUP BY clause (excluding the GROUP BY itself). Passing null will cause the rows to not be grouped.

A filter declare which row groups to include in the cursor, if row grouping is being used, formatted as an SQL HAVING clause (excluding the HAVING itself). Passing null will cause all row groups to be included, and is required when row grouping is not being used.
Docs.summary: Construct a SELECT statement suitable for use in a group of SELECT statements that will be joined through UNION operators in buildUnionQuery.

A list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns, which is discouraged to prevent reading data from storage that isn't going to be used.
A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given URL.
You may include ?s in selection, which will be replaced by the values from selectionArgs, in order that they appear in the selection. The values will be bound as Strings.
A filter declaring how to group rows, formatted as an SQL GROUP BY clause (excluding the GROUP BY itself). Passing null will cause the rows to not be grouped.

A filter declare which row groups to include in the cursor, if row grouping is being used, formatted as an SQL HAVING clause (excluding the HAVING itself). Passing null will cause all row groups to be included, and is required when row grouping is not being used.
How to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
Docs.summary: Perform a query by combining all current settings and the information passed into this method.
Docs.returns: a cursor over the result set

Docs.param: the database to query on
A list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns, which is discouraged to prevent reading data from storage that isn't going to be used.
A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given URL.
You may include ?s in selection, which will be replaced by the values from selectionArgs, in order that they appear in the selection. The values will be bound as Strings.
A filter declaring how to group rows, formatted as an SQL GROUP BY clause (excluding the GROUP BY itself). Passing null will cause the rows to not be grouped.

A filter declare which row groups to include in the cursor, if row grouping is being used, formatted as an SQL HAVING clause (excluding the HAVING itself). Passing null will cause all row groups to be included, and is required when row grouping is not being used.
How to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
Limits the number of rows returned by the query, formatted as LIMIT clause. Passing null denotes no LIMIT clause.
Docs.summary: Perform a query by combining all current settings and the information passed into this method.
Docs.returns: a cursor over the result set

MemberSignature.Usage: sQLiteQueryBuilder.Query (db, projectionIn, selection, selectionArgs, groupBy, having, sortOrder, limit, cancellationSignal)

Docs.param: the database to query on
A list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns, which is discouraged to prevent reading data from storage that isn't going to be used.
A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given URL.
You may include ?s in selection, which will be replaced by the values from selectionArgs, in order that they appear in the selection. The values will be bound as Strings.
A filter declaring how to group rows, formatted as an SQL GROUP BY clause (excluding the GROUP BY itself). Passing null will cause the rows to not be grouped.

A filter declare which row groups to include in the cursor, if row grouping is being used, formatted as an SQL HAVING clause (excluding the HAVING itself). Passing null will cause all row groups to be included, and is required when row grouping is not being used.
How to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
Limits the number of rows returned by the query, formatted as LIMIT clause. Passing null denotes no LIMIT clause.
A signal to cancel the operation in progress, or null if none. If the operation is canceled, then OperationCanceledException will be thrown when the query is executed.
Docs.summary: Perform a query by combining all current settings and the information passed into this method.
Docs.returns: a cursor over the result set
